definitions.definition: the part of food that helps to keep a person healthy by keeping the bowels working and moving other food quickly through the body

examples.text: Dried fruits are especially **high in fibre**.
He has been advised to increase his fibre intake.
Peaches are a good source of fibre.
foods that are rich in fibre
foods that have a high fibre content
the problems associated with a low fibre diet
your total daily intake of dietary fibre

definitions.definition: a material such as cloth or rope that is made from a mass of natural or artificial threads

examples.text: Wear underwear that is made from natural fibres.

definitions.definition: one of the many thin threads that form body tissue, such as muscle, and natural materials, such as wood and cotton

examples.text: She loved him with every fibre of her being.
The disease is characterized by degeneration of muscle fibres.
The function of nerve fibres is to transmit coded information from one place to another.
Mechanical filters draw air through flat, coarse fibres.
Wood fibres or synthetic fibres may be used in the manufacturing process.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘lobe of the liver’, (plural) ‘entrails’): via French from Latin fibra ‘fibre, filament, entrails’.
